comments.body:
Dear iforgot 2 years ago,
We need to talk. You know, I hate it when I get called an idiot. Maybe I shouldn't be offending myself, but I WAS an idiot. None of these ideas are good, and most of them sound like they could've been written by a fetus in fetu (If you don't know what that is, please don't search it up). To say the least, every post starting from now, if I ever decide to write another, will be planned in many more than 5 minutes. If I don't keep that promise, I'll just shut up and leave. Who the hell did I think I was? Dumbledore?
Signed,
iforgot now (2020)
Not realistic, however. Most mules are infertile.
Mules are sterile…
Well technically mules can be fertile, its just more unlikely than getting hit by lighting.

you should get carpet.
Пишите по английски свой посты.И говорите идею чётко и понятно. Можете расписать всё до деталях

[PART 2]:

In terms of effectiveness in Combat, the Telekinesis Illager would be dangerous with other Illagers due to Interrupting attacks from the player, but alone, the Telekinesis Illager would be weak since it doesn't use any weapon, just the two attacks mentioned above, the best defense against one would be boots with Feather Falling.

As for their Drops, they'll drop 2-4 experience points, 1-2 Emeralds (Guarrenteed) and very rarely (2%) A Diamond. Looting Levels will increase the chance of a Diamond by 2% per level.

I re-textured an Illusioner to show what the Telekinesis Illager would look like:

They have 10 Hearts of Health (20 HP) and the best way of attacking them would be with a Ranged Weapon (Bow, trident etc.)

An Ilager mob with telekinetic powers sounds like a great idea besides Minecraft doesn't currently have any creature with a talent like that it should be made for bedrock players as well just to let you know

Mojang of course. Maybe also consider bringing in the ilusioner to bedrock while you are at the topic of the illagers?

Really interesting Idea, I like it, but I believe the clothing showed in your comment of part 2 below should be a little darker to make it seem more like an evil person, instead of diamonds it should be emeralds to sort of match with illagers still being villagers in a sort of way. But anyways, good idea.
Just realized that one of the Illagers in the Minecraft Dungeons Image in the Launcher looks a LOT like this, honestly not sure if that was a coincidence or not, still cool to find!

Anyway if the easy-breaking of leashes is a new update, this one is definitely a good idea.

Hey, I did a post about a red sand valley and a cool mob for it would be the roadrunner. I linked my post to yours.

They both really fit the aesthetic of the Trial Chambers.

Some uses they could have within the structure could be:

Copper Golems could maybe spawn naturally in the Trial Chambers with their function being activating traps with a combat trial room. For example they'd have a little control room you can see from within the room where they are randomly hitting buttons that cause the floor to open up trying to trap not just you but whatever you're fighting.

Tuff Golems could be in the final room of the Trial Chambers holding the higher end/ unique items from the structure.
END THE VOTES!! WE WANT THEM ALL!!
He/she is right mojang pls add
add the golem
Copper golem :)

The reason Copper and Tuff lost was mostly due to usability for most players. A random button or moving item frame just isn't that handy for survival or builds. Now their "cool down" mechanics are perfect for what more useful golems should be modeled with to do the following functions:

Guarding-(gloom-like) This golem will patrol around the edge of a lite area and will alarm at nearby hostiles, summoning Iron or snow golems (possibly a new ranged attack golem) it may periodically just chill in a spot. It can be led by a lead but will only alter at hostiles if in a lite area, making it a useful mob to watch your back when solo mining.

Automaters- these golems will tackle grinding tasks for players and have a maintenance or cool-down need to ensure players check up on them. Fishing, Farming, Lumber harvesting (log block breaker), Cobblestone block breaker, and Item sorting; are all tasks players would love to automate, and that could be balanced by golems that do cool-downs or need maintenance periodically. 

Attacking/Defense- this is mostly filled already but; an improved ranged or smart turret that could be limited by actual ammo consumption (buffed by being able to toss potions) and a shield/wall golem that is 2 tall and will move in front of ranged hostiles to block their shots are two niches that need a golem. Beyond ways to improve Iron or Snow which seems unlikely to happen.
OP. It would be too accessible, preferrable, and makes elytra obsolete. Game balance is key.
